title: Physical Activity Basics and Your Health
body:
**Key Facts:**
Physical activity can make you feel better, function better and sleep better. The amount of physical activity you need depends largely on your age. There are many ways to add physical activity to your daily life, regardless of your starting point.

**Benefits:**
Physical activity delivers immediate and short-term benefits, such as improved mood, energy and sleep quality, and reduced stress, anxiety and depression. Long-term benefits include lower risks of heart disease, stroke, type 2 diabetes and some cancers; stronger bones, muscles and joints; healthier weight maintenance; improved blood pressure and blood sugar regulation. Specific advantages include promoting healthy growth, motor skills and cognitive development in children, and supporting balance, coordination, strength and independence in older adults.

**Recommendations and Tips:**
Physical activity needs vary by age and health status. Guidelines outline how much activity counts for children, adults, older adults, pregnant and postpartum women, and individuals with chronic conditions or disabilities. Activities can range from walking and recreational play to structured exercise and sports. Even small amounts of activity offer benefits, and itâ€™s never too late to start.

**Key Takeaways:**
Physical activity is essential for both physical and mental health. There are many forms of activity to suit different preferences and abilities. All ages and life stages benefit from regular movement, and people should seek guidance tailored to their age, health conditions or circumstances to meet recommended activity levels.
